description: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard markup language used to create web pages. It defines the structure of a webpage using elements and tags.
experience: Used in nearly every project to structure content, create semantic layouts, and ensure accessibility.
blog: Semantic HTML helps search engines and screen readers interpret web content more effectively.

description: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used for styling HTML elements and making the web visually attractive with colors, layouts, and animations.
experience: Styled components, implemented responsive designs using media queries and Flexbox.
blog: Mastering Flexbox and Grid makes CSS super powerful and flexible.

description: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework for rapid UI development using predefined classes.
experience: Built full UIs using utility classes, customized themes with config files, and improved developer speed.
blog: Tailwind speeds up development and keeps design consistent across projects.

description: Bootstrap is a component-based CSS framework that helps in designing responsive and mobile-first websites quickly.
experience: Used pre-built components and grid system in several personal and freelance projects.
blog: Bootstrap is great for fast prototyping and making responsive designs easy.

description: JavaScript is a versatile scripting language used to create dynamic and interactive content on web pages.
experience: Handled form validation, fetch APIs, DOM manipulation, and interactive features.
blog: Understanding JavaScript deeply is key to becoming a frontend wizard.

description: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces with reusable components and efficient rendering.
experience: Built dynamic SPAs with hooks, props, state management, and routing.
blog: React’s component logic is great for code reusability and maintainability.

description: Angular is a TypeScript-based framework for building large-scale enterprise-grade applications.
experience: Created form handling, services, and routing modules in practice projects.
blog: Angular has a steep learning curve but offers powerful built-in solutions.

description: Java is a robust object-oriented programming language used widely in enterprise and Android development.
experience: Built backend logic, used OOP principles, and created REST APIs using Spring Boot.
blog: Love Java’s reliability, structure, and huge ecosystem.

description: Spring Boot is a Java-based framework that simplifies the setup of microservices and web applications.
experience: Developed REST APIs, integrated databases, and used dependency injection and annotations.
blog: Spring Boot makes enterprise app development a breeze.

description: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome’s V8 engine used for server-side scripting.
experience: Built server-side logic, REST APIs, and integrated it with Express and MongoDB.
blog: Node.js is non-blocking and super-fast for IO-heavy apps.

description: Express.js is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework.
experience: Created RESTful APIs, middleware, and routing logic in full-stack MERN projects.
blog: Express simplifies the backend development with minimal setup.

description: TypeScript is a typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JS and helps catch errors at compile time.
experience: Used in Angular projects and React apps for safer code structure.
blog: TypeScript is must-have for big codebases and team projects.

description: Python is a dynamic high-level programming language used for web, data science, automation and more.
experience: Used for scripting, small backend services and learning automation.
blog: Python’s syntax is super beginner-friendly and readable.

description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system that uses structured query language.
experience: Created tables, joined queries, and managed data using SQL scripts.
blog: Understanding normalization and indexes helped optimize DBs.

description: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that stores data in JSON-like flexible documents.
experience: Integrated with Express & Node, created schemas and queried collections.
blog: Love Mongo’s flexibility and fast prototyping capabilities.
